description.narrative: Support Morocco to adopt the methodologies, action plans and tools to implement green city and territorial development projects, develop two green city and territory project proposals to leverage financing. Provide technical support to Morocco to implement its NSDS and its NDC n°9 commitment to develop a model framework for low-carbon green territories including optimized energy, transport and waste management, in alignment with its ongoing advanced regionalization transition.

The Kingdom of Morocco is acutely vulnerable to climate change and is prone to environmental constraints (water scarcity, land degradation, energy dependence, pollution, natural resource depletion). These increasing pressures are a catalyst for rural migration, as the rural economy largely depends on subsistence farming, further straining urban areas and their limited capacities and resources. The Government of Morocco has been cultivating an inclusive green economy for a number of years in collaboration with international development partners. Additionally, in the NSDS, urban development issues are emphasized, with a focus on conceptualizing territories as sustainable ecosystems, and improving design, coordination and implementation of urban interventions and rural-urban linkages. Such examples provide a strong foundation for GGGI’s Morocco country program, which encompasses green territorial development, the circular and social solidarity economy, and implementing the NSDS on a sub-national level.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04540 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: "Green Cities and Territories" - Project Results Report

description.narrative: 1. July 26, 2018: Knowledge sharing and exchange meeting around the structuring and implementation of an NFV in Morocco, supporting the process of the implementation of the National Strategy for Sustainable Development (NSSD) and National Determined Contributions (NDC). Highlighting GGGI's expertise in this area with the participation of GGGI GIS. 2. October 1-2, 2018: Conducted Output D3: regional knowledge exchange on green cities development. Participated in the GGGI-Government of Egypt joint workshop on Egypt’s green growth potential, which was a capacity building workshop on green growth concepts and approaches in Cairo, Egypt. 3. November 26-29, 2018: Knowledge sharing event at GGGW2018 in Senegal: sharing of Morocco experiences in urban mobility through low carbon initiatives under structuring with the Secretary of State in Charge of Transport, as part of the development of green cities and territories program.

title.narrative: Deliver 3 training events per year to strengthen the knowledge and skills of participants
Two green city and territory implementation projects designed

description.narrative: Through consultation and data analysis, GGGI has selected pilot territories through a mapping that identifies marginalized territories, and territories facing particular resource pressures (Activity E4). The territories that have been identified are the Draa ? Tafilalet region, which contains vulnerable oasis and mountain ecosystems. A total of 40.00% of the national territory is considered part of the oasis ecosystem. The second region identified is the Beni Mellal ? Khenifra region, which also contains a marginalized mountain ecosystem. These activities have led to the drafting of two climate finance projects for implementation and financing within the scope of the green city and territory model which is described below: 2 climate finance projects designed as PINs and approved by GGGI Management Team: ? The development of a multi-sector NFV to support territories in accessing green financing for the implementation of bankable programs and projects within the framework of support for the implementation of the national sustainable development strategy and the NDCs; ? Support to Regional Project Execution Agencies (AREPs) in structuring a pipeline of bankable projects to attract green investments and accelerate the transition to a green and low carbon economy, financeable via the NFV, in the areas of expertise of the GGGI

title.narrative: Government of Morocco (GoM) or relevant financier leverage finance for green city territorial projects

description.narrative: Upon request from the Ministry of Interior, GGGI and Green Investment Services (GIS) teams conducted an assessment mission where a series of bilateral meetings were held with key ministries and stakeholders. The results provided the background material for the development of a PIN that covers two technical assistance projects. Upon request by the Secretary of State for Transport, the TL team conducted technical assessment on green transport policy development. The result provided the material for GGGI Concept Notes, which are under development. These Concept Notes aim to provide GGGI Morocco with earmarked project funding.

title.narrative: The creation of a model, low-carbon city centered on energy-efficiency actions, transport and waste management (NDC no. 9)

Contribute to the total emission reduction potential of 1,232 million tons of CO2 related to NDC no.9 between 2020-2030 Increasing the sorting-recycling-recovery rate to 20% by 2020; Contribute to the National target of reaching 60% of treated wastewater by 2020 and of 100% by 2030. Contribute to the National target of reuse 50% of wastewater in inland cities by 2020. Number of regions involved
